result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: filed by Atty Adam Raabe

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

3:37 PM 
Defendant Nevaeh S Jones in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Nevaeh S Jones.  Attorney Kelly A Cassidy in court for State of Wisconsin. 
ADA Cassidy calls the case and states appearances.
Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT: 
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.

Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  
Bond continued. 

Atty Raabe inquires as to the defendant being excused for the pre-trial conference.
ADA Cassidy states that the matter can likely be reset for a plea date prior to the pre-trial conference.
Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Pre-trial conference on November 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

1:50 PM Defendant Nevaeh S Jones in court.  Attorney Adam Raabe in court for Nevaeh S Jones.  Attorney Jedidiah Dodge in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Attorney/Defendant received a copy of the criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of the charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of the complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for the preliminary hearing to be held.
Defendant is willing to waive her right to a preliminary hearing.
Court informs Atty Raabe that because the Court is a bit behind that he would like him to e file the Waiver of Preliminary Examination.
Atty Raabe to file a paper document of the Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/public defender representation.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on October 17, 2022 at 03:00 pm.

Initial Appearance set for 08/22/22 @ 2:00 p.m. in Br 1

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.

Defendant Nevaeha S Jones appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Andrew August Mutchler in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney (Atty) Max Bergner appears in person, on behalf of Defendant, for today's hearing.

1:06 PM Court calls case.
Atty Mutchler states appearances.
This is a riverside hearing.

ADA Mutchler states facts for anticipated charges of possession of drug paraphernalia and meth, resisting/obstructing an officer. 
Atty Bergner  does not have anything to state about the facts of the case.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court states facts, for the record.

Court informs defendant of right to an attorney and/or public defender.
Public defender's office will appoint counsel for Defendant.

State requests a $250 cash bond with conditions as stated, for reasons stated.
Atty Bergner addresses the Court regarding bond, requests signature bond for reasons stated.
Hearing scheduled for August 22, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
